title: Vector Addition
text: Calculate the $$x$$ vector and $$y$$ vector lengths for Vectors A and B to find the total length of the resulting vector R using pythagorean theorem.

title: Trigonometry
text: Solve $$30cos\left(68\right)-27.5cos\left(66\right)$$ where $$27.5cos\left(66\right)$$ is the $$x$$ vector length for vector A and $$30cos\left(68\right)$$ is the $$x$$ vector length for vector B. Solve $$30sin\left(68\right)+27.5sin\left(66\right)$$ where $$27.5sin\left(66\right)$$ is the $$y$$ vector length for vector A and $$30sin\left(68\right)$$ is the $$y$$ vector length for vector B. Now use pythagorean theorem for the total length.
